ibis.io

Class IbisSerializationOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • ibis.io.ByteSerializationOutputStream
      • ibis.io.DataSerializationOutputStream
        • ibis.io.IbisSerializationOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataOutput, SerializationOutput

    public class IbisSerializationOutputStream
extends DataSerializationOutputStream
    This is the SerializationOutputStream version that is used for Ibis serialization.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Replacer replacer
      Accessed from IOGenerator-generated code.

      • setReplacer

        public void setReplacer(Replacer replacer)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Set a replacer. The replacement mechanism can be used to replace an object with another object during serialization. This is used in RMI, for instance, to replace a remote object with a stub.
        Specified by:
        setReplacer in interface SerializationOutput
        Overrides:
        setReplacer in class ByteSerializationOutputStream
        Parameters:
        replacer - the replacer object to be associated with this output stream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when the implementation refuses to set the replacer, for instance when it is not an object serialization.

        public void writeClass(java.lang.Class<?> ref)
                throws java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

      • writeKnownObjectHeader

        public int writeKnownObjectHeader(java.lang.Object ref)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a (new or old) handle for object ref to the output stream. Returns 1 if the object is new, -1 if not.
        Parameters:
        ref - the object whose handle is to be written
        Returns:
        1 if it is a new object, -1 if it is not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - gets thrown when an IO error occurs.

      • writeKnownArrayHeader

        public int writeKnownArrayHeader(java.lang.Object ref,
                                 int typehandle)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a (new or old) handle for array of primitives ref to the output stream. Returns 1 if the object is new, -1 if not.
        Parameters:
        ref - the object whose handle is to be written
        typehandle - the type number
        Returns:
        1 if it is a new object, -1 if it is not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - gets thrown when an IO error occurs.

      • push_current_object

        public void push_current_object(java.lang.Object ref,
                                int level)
        Push the notions of current_object, current_level, and current_putfield on their stacks, and set new ones.
        Parameters:
        ref - the new current_object notion
        level - the new current_level notion

      • pop_current_object

        public void pop_current_object()
        Pop the notions of current_object, current_level, and current_putfield from their stacks.

      • writeSerializableObject

        public void writeSerializableObject(java.lang.Object ref,
                                    java.lang.String classname)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        This method takes care of writing the serializable fields of the parent object, and also those of its parent objects. It gets called by IOGenerator-generated code when an object has a superclass that is serializable but not Ibis serializable.
        Parameters:
        ref - the object with a non-Ibis-serializable parent object
        classname - the name of the superclass
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - gets thrown on IO error

      • writeString

        public void writeString(java.lang.String ref)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a String object. This is a special case, because strings are written as an UTF.
        Specified by:
        writeString in interface SerializationOutput
        Overrides:
        writeString in class DataSerializationOutputStream
        Parameters:
        ref - the string to be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - gets thrown on IO error

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(java.lang.Object ref)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Write objects and arrays. Duplicates are deteced when this call is used. The replacement mechanism is implemented here as well.
        Specified by:
        writeObject in interface SerializationOutput
        Overrides:
        writeObject in class ByteSerializationOutputStream
        Parameters:
        ref - the object to be written
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown when an IO error occurs.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: SerializationOutput
        Flushes and closes this stream, and flushes the underlying streams.
        Specified by:
        close in interface SerializationOutput
        Overrides:
        close in class DataSerializationOutputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - an error occurred

      • defaultWriteSerializableObject

        public void defaultWriteSerializableObject(java.lang.Object ref,
                                           int depth)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method writes the serializable fields of object ref at the level indicated by depth. (see the explanation at the declaration of the current_level field). It gets called from IOGenerator-generated code, when a parent object is serializable but not Ibis serializable.
        Parameters:
        ref - the object of which serializable fields must be written
        depth - an indication of the current "view" of the object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - gets thrown when an IO error occurs.

        public java.io.ObjectOutputStream getJavaObjectOutputStream()
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
